_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Types of one-sided immersion [dn6:5.6.0]: to the eastern quarter so as to see heavenly sights but not to hear heavenly sounds
to the southern quarter so as to see heavenly sights but not to hear heavenly sounds
to the western quarter so as to see heavenly sights but not to hear heavenly sounds
to the northern quarter so as to see heavenly sights but not to hear heavenly sounds
above, below, across so as to see heavenly sights but not to hear heavenly sounds
to the eastern quarter so as to hear heavenly sounds but not to see heavenly sights
to the southern quarter so as to hear heavenly sounds but not to see heavenly sights
to the western quarter so as to hear heavenly sounds but not to see heavenly sights
to the northern quarter so as to hear heavenly sounds but not to see heavenly sights
above, below, across so as to hear heavenly sounds but not to see heavenly sights
Types of two-sided immersion [dn6:5.6.0]: to the eastern quarter so as to both hear heavenly sounds and see heavenly sights
to the southern quarter so as to both hear heavenly sounds and see heavenly sights
to the western quarter so as to both hear heavenly sounds and see heavenly sights
to the northern quarter so as to both hear heavenly sounds and see heavenly sights
above, below, across so as to both hear heavenly sounds and see heavenly sights
The Four Noble Fruits [dn6:13.0]: With the ending of three fetters, a mendicant is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
With the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, a mendicant is a once-returner. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.
With the ending of the five lower fetters, a mendicant is reborn spontaneously and will become extinguished there, not liable to return from that world.
A mendicant has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
The different levels of absorption [dn6:: They enter and remain in the first absorption
They enter and remain in the second absorption
They enter and remain in the third absorption
They enter and remain in the fourth absorption
The different states of knowledge and vi: They extend and project the mind toward knowledge and vision
They understand: “… there is no return to any state of existence.”
